results.title: A randomised controlled trial of calcium channel blockade (CCB) with Amlodipine For the treatment oF subcortical ischaEmic vasCular demenTia (AFFECT): study protocol
results.text_hl: This study is designed to investigate whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ can produce benefits compared to placebo in established @<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@SIVD@@@.

citations.NLM: Greenan C, Murphy L, Yu LM, Kehoe PG, Coulthard E, Bath P, Stewart R, Jones R, Corbett A, Thomas A, Connelly P, Arrojo F, Canning R, Wallach S, Henderson C, McGuinness B, O'Sullivan M, Holmes C, Knapp M, Ballard C, Passmore P, AFFECT Investigators. results.title: Combination benefit of amlodipine plus atorvastatin treatment on carotid atherosclerosis in Zucker metabolic rats.
results.text_hl: METHODS: We studied effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, and their combination on carotid @<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@arteriosclerotic@@@ processes in a @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@ model of @DISEASE_Lipoma @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@Zucker fatty@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Kawai H, Kurata T, Deguchi K, Deguchi S, Yamashita T, Ohta Y, Omote Y, Kono S, Abe K. Combination benefit of amlodipine plus atorvastatin treatment on carotid atherosclerosis in Zucker metabolic rats. Neurol Res. 2013 Mar;35(2):181-6. PMID: 23336931

results.title: Protective effects of various calcium antagonists against experimental arteriosclerosis.
results.text_hl: The new @CHEMICAL_1_4_dihydropyridine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C038806 @@@1,4-dihydropyridine@@@ @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ antagonist @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ has been shown to inhibit @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ accumulation in the internal elastic membrane of abdominal arteries of @CHEMICAL_Sodium_Chloride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012965 @@@NaCl@@@-loaded @CHEMICAL_Salts @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012492 @@@salt@@@-sensitive Dahl-S @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, and consequently also exerts protective effects against @<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@arteriosclerotic lesions@@@, shown particularly in the distal mesenteric artery branches.

citations.NLM: Fleckenstein-Grün G, Frey M, Thimm F, Fleckenstein A. Protective effects of various calcium antagonists against experimental arteriosclerosis. J Hum Hypertens. 1992 Dec;6 Suppl 1():S13-8. PMID: 1293304
citations.BibTeX: @article{1293304, title={Protective effects of various calcium antagonists against experimental arteriosclerosis.}, author={Fleckenstein-Grün G and Frey M and Thimm F and Fleckenstein A}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={6 Suppl 1}, pages={S13-8}}

results.title: Prevention of hyperglycemic signal pathways in metabolic syndrome carotid artery of rats.
results.text_hl: Our present immunohistochemical study first demonstrated that a combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ treatment prevented an @<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@arteriosclerotic@@@ process compared to the single treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ with strong recoveries of pTyr @GENE_IRS1 @GENE_25467 @@@IRS-1@@@, pPI3K, and pAkt expressions and with remarkable restraints of @GENE_IGF1 @GENE_24482 @@@IGF-1@@@ and pSer @GENE_IRS1 @GENE_25467 @@@IRS-1@@@.

citations.NLM: Kawai H, Tian F, Kurata T, Deguchi K, Yamashita T, Omote Y, Kono S, Abe K. Prevention of hyperglycemic signal pathways in metabolic syndrome carotid artery of rats. Transl Stroke Res. 2012 Dec;3(4):466-72. PMID: 24323833
citations.BibTeX: @article{24323833, title={Prevention of hyperglycemic signal pathways in metabolic syndrome carotid artery of rats.}, author={Kawai H and Tian F and Kurata T and Deguchi K and Yamashita T and Omote Y and Kono S and Abe K}, journal={Transl Stroke Res}, volume={3}, number={4}, pages={466-72}}

results.title: Development of an experimentally useful model of acute myocardial infarction: 2/3 nephrectomized triple nitric oxide synthases-deficient mouse.
results.text_hl: Importantly, combined treatment with a clinical dosage of an angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker, @CHEMICAL_Irbesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077405 @@@irbesartan@@@, and a @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ channel antagonist, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, markedly prevented @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary arteriosclerotic lesion@@@ formation and the incidence of @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@AMI@@@ and improved the prognosis of those @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, along with ameliorating all those pro-@<m>DISEASE_Dementia_Vascular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015140 @@@arteriosclerotic@@@ parameters.

citations.NLM: Uchida T, Furuno Y, Tanimoto A, Toyohira Y, Arakaki K, Kina-Tanada M, Kubota H, Sakanashi M, Matsuzaki T, Noguchi K, Nakasone J, Igarashi T, Ueno S, Matsushita M, Ishiuchi S, Masuzaki H, Ohya Y, Yanagihara N, Shimokawa H, Otsuji Y, Tamura M, Tsutsui M. Development of an experimentally useful model of acute myocardial infarction: 2/3 nephrectomized triple nitric oxide synthases-deficient mouse. J Mol Cell Cardiol. 2014 Dec;77():29-41. PMID: 25265498
